title: Customising brain atlases
text: ggseg.formats provides three groups manipulation functions. Region functions (atlas_region_*) control regions active atlas. View functions (atlas_view_*) control 2D sf geometry—views present arranged. Core functions (atlas_core_*) enrich region metadata. accept ggseg_atlas first argument, return new ggseg_atlas, play nicely pipe.

title: Customising brain atlases
text: atlas_region_remove() strips region entirely—core, palette, sf geometry, 3D data. pattern argument passed grepl() ignore.case = TRUE, partial matches work: atlas_region_keep() inverse: keeps regions match turns everything else context geometry (sf preserved surface continuity, non-matching regions leave core palette): functions accept match_on argument choose whether pattern matches "region" (default, human-readable name) "label" (unique identifier):
code: no_cc <- atlas_region_remove(dk, "corpus callosum") "corpus callosum" %in% atlas_regions(no_cc) #> [1] FALSE frontal <- atlas_region_keep(dk, "frontal") atlas_regions(frontal) #> [1] "caudal middle frontal"  "frontal pole"           "lateral orbitofrontal"  #> [4] "medial orbitofrontal"   "rostral middle frontal" "superior frontal" lh_only <- atlas_region_keep(dk, "^lh_", match_on = "label") head(atlas_labels(lh_only)) #> [1] "lh_bankssts"                "lh_caudalanteriorcingulate" #> [3] "lh_caudalmiddlefrontal"     "lh_corpuscallosum"          #> [5] "lh_cuneus"                  "lh_entorhinal"

title: Customising brain atlases
text: Sometimes want region’s polygon stay visible (rendered grey) appear legend carry data. atlas_region_contextual() . removes region core, palette, 3D data leaves sf geometry place: Compare atlas_region_remove(), delete ventricle polygons entirely, leaving gaps 2D slices.
code: ctx <- atlas_region_contextual(aseg, "ventricle") "lateral ventricle" %in% atlas_regions(ctx) #> [1] FALSE

title: Customising brain atlases
text: atlas_region_rename() changes region column without touching label (geometry links stay intact). Pass fixed string: pass function programmatic renaming:
code: renamed <- atlas_region_rename(   dk, "banks of superior temporal sulcus", "STS banks" ) "STS banks" %in% atlas_regions(renamed) #> [1] TRUE upper <- atlas_region_rename(dk, ".*", toupper) head(atlas_regions(upper)) #> [1] "BANKS OF SUPERIOR TEMPORAL SULCUS" "CAUDAL ANTERIOR CINGULATE"         #> [3] "CAUDAL MIDDLE FRONTAL"             "CORPUS CALLOSUM"                   #> [5] "CUNEUS"                            "ENTORHINAL"

title: Customising brain atlases
text: atlas_views() tells 2D views atlas : atlas_view_keep() atlas_view_remove() filter views pattern. want sagittal slice: remove several views passing vector:
code: atlas_views(aseg) #> [1] "axial_3"   "axial_5"   "coronal_2" "coronal_3" "coronal_4" "sagittal" sag <- atlas_view_keep(aseg, "sagittal") atlas_views(sag) #> [1] "sagittal" fewer <- atlas_view_remove(aseg, c("axial_3", "coronal_2")) atlas_views(fewer) #> [1] "axial_5"   "coronal_3" "coronal_4" "sagittal"

title: Customising brain atlases
text: filtering regions may small polygon fragments left —tiny slivers region just barely crossed slice plane. atlas_view_remove_small() removes region polygons minimum area threshold. Context polygons (core) never removed: can scope removal specific views: atlas_view_remove_region() removes specific region’s sf geometry without touching core, palette, 3D data. useful region’s 2D projection misleading still want 3D:
code: cleaned <- atlas_view_remove_small(aseg, min_area = 50) #> ℹ Removed 13 geometries below area 50 cleaned_sag <- atlas_view_remove_small(aseg, min_area = 50, views = "sagittal") #> ℹ Removed 3 geometries below area 50 no_stem_sf <- atlas_view_remove_region(aseg, "brain stem", match_on = "region")

title: Customising brain atlases
text: remove views, remaining geometry keeps original coordinates, can leave awkward gaps. atlas_view_gather() repositions views side--side configurable gap: atlas_view_reorder() lets choose left--right order repositions time. Views mentioned order appended end:
code: trimmed <- aseg |>   atlas_view_keep(c("sagittal", "coronal_3", "axial_3")) |>   atlas_view_gather() atlas_views(trimmed) #> [1] "axial_3"   "coronal_3" "sagittal" reordered <- aseg |>   atlas_view_keep(c("sagittal", "coronal_3", "axial_3")) |>   atlas_view_reorder(c("axial_3", "sagittal", "coronal_3")) atlas_views(reordered) #> [1] "axial_3"   "sagittal"  "coronal_3"

title: Customising brain atlases
text: atlas_core_add() left-joins data frame onto core table. useful attaching grouping variables, statistical results, per-region information. add custom network column handful regions: argument defaults "region" can join shared column.
code: network_info <- data.frame(   region = c(     "superior frontal", "precuneus",     "inferior parietal", "posterior cingulate"   ),   network = "default mode" ) enriched <- atlas_core_add(dk, network_info) enriched$core[!is.na(enriched$core$network), c("region", "network")] #> # A tibble: 8 × 2 #>   region              network      #>   <chr>               <chr>        #> 1 inferior parietal   default mode #> 2 posterior cingulate default mode #> 3 precuneus           default mode #> 4 superior frontal    default mode #> 5 inferior parietal   default mode #> 6 posterior cingulate default mode #> 7 precuneus           default mode #> 8 superior frontal    default mode

title: Customising brain atlases
text: realistic pipeline prepares aseg atlas compact two-view figure deep grey matter structures: function returns valid ggseg_atlas, can inspect intermediate results, branch pipeline, hand final object straight ggseg plotting.
code: publication_aseg <- aseg |>   atlas_view_keep(c("sagittal", "coronal_3")) |>   atlas_region_contextual("ventricle|choroid|white|cc") |>   atlas_view_remove_small(min_area = 30) |>   atlas_view_gather(gap = 0.1) #> ℹ Removed 3 geometries below area 30  publication_aseg #>  #> ── aseg ggseg atlas ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Type: subcortical #> Regions: 15 #> Hemispheres: left, NA, right #> Views: coronal_3, sagittal #> Palette: ✔ #> Rendering: ✔ ggseg #> ✔ ggseg3d (meshes) #> ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> # A tibble: 23 × 4 #>    hemi  region                        label             structure       #>    <chr> <chr>                         <chr>             <chr>           #>  1 left  thalamus                      Left-Thalamus     thalamus        #>  2 left  caudate                       Left-Caudate      basal ganglia   #>  3 left  putamen                       Left-Putamen      basal ganglia   #>  4 left  pallidum                      Left-Pallidum     basal ganglia   #>  5 NA    brain stem                    Brain-Stem        brain stem      #>  6 left  hippocampus                   Left-Hippocampus  limbic          #>  7 left  amygdala                      Left-Amygdala     limbic          #>  8 left  ventral diencephalon          Left-VentralDC    diencephalon    #>  9 left  vessel                        Left-vessel       NA              #> 10 right thalamus                      Right-Thalamus    thalamus        #> 11 right caudate                       Right-Caudate     basal ganglia   #> 12 right putamen                       Right-Putamen     basal ganglia   #> 13 right pallidum                      Right-Pallidum    basal ganglia   #> 14 right hippocampus                   Right-Hippocampus limbic          #> 15 right amygdala                      Right-Amygdala    limbic          #> 16 right ventral diencephalon          Right-VentralDC   diencephalon    #> 17 right vessel                        Right-vessel      NA              #> 18 NA    optic chiasm                  Optic-Chiasm      NA              #> 19 NA    corpus callosum posterior     CC_Posterior      corpus callosum #> 20 NA    corpus callosum mid-posterior CC_Mid_Posterior  corpus callosum #> 21 NA    corpus callosum central       CC_Central        corpus callosum #> 22 NA    corpus callosum mid-anterior  CC_Mid_Anterior   corpus callosum #> 23 NA    corpus callosum anterior      CC_Anterior       corpus callosum

title: The ggseg_atlas object
text: five slots accessed $: $atlas short name (used look atlases string) $type one "cortical", "subcortical", "tract". $palette named character vector mapping labels hex colours: $core data frame one row per region. always region label columns, often include hemi additional metadata like lobe structure: Finally, $data ggseg_atlas_data object holds actual geometry. contents depend atlas type.
code: dk$atlas #> [1] "dk" dk$type #> [1] "cortical" head(dk$palette) #>                lh_bankssts lh_caudalanteriorcingulate  #>                  "#196428"                  "#7D64A0"  #>     lh_caudalmiddlefrontal          lh_corpuscallosum  #>                  "#641900"                  "#784632"  #>                  lh_cuneus              lh_entorhinal  #>                  "#DC1464"                  "#DC140A" head(dk$core) #> # A tibble: 6 × 4 #>   hemi  region                            label                      lobe        #>   <chr> <chr>                             <chr>                      <chr>       #> 1 left  banks of superior temporal sulcus lh_bankssts                temporal    #> 2 left  caudal anterior cingulate         lh_caudalanteriorcingulate cingulate   #> 3 left  caudal middle frontal             lh_caudalmiddlefrontal     frontal     #> 4 left  corpus callosum                   lh_corpuscallosum          white matt… #> 5 left  cuneus                            lh_cuneus                  occipital   #> 6 left  entorhinal                        lh_entorhinal              temporal class(dk$data) #> [1] "ggseg_data_cortical" "ggseg_atlas_data"

title: The ggseg_atlas object
text: ggseg.formats ships three atlases illustrate three types. Cortical atlases like dk parcellate cortical surface. data object ggseg_data_cortical containing sf polygons 2D rendering vertex indices 3D: Subcortical atlases like aseg represent deep brain structures. data ggseg_data_subcortical sf polygons individual 3D meshes: Tract atlases like tracula represent white matter bundles. data ggseg_data_tract sf polygons centerlines generate tube meshes 3D: every case sf component drives 2D plotting type-specific component (vertices, meshes, centerlines) drives 3D.
code: dk$type #> [1] "cortical" names(dk$data) #> [1] "sf"       "vertices" aseg$type #> [1] "subcortical" names(aseg$data) #> [1] "sf"     "meshes" tracula$type #> [1] "tract" names(tracula$data) #> [1] "sf"            "centerlines"   "tube_radius"   "tube_segments"

title: The ggseg_atlas object
text: $core data frame single source truth regions atlas contains. Every manipulation function updates core first propagates changes geometry palette. required columns region (human-readable name) label (unique identifier links core geometry). atlases also carry hemi: atlases include additional metadata columns. dk atlas, instance, lobe: can add metadata atlas_core_add() (covered manipulation vignette).
code: str(dk$core) #> tibble [70 × 4] (S3: tbl_df/tbl/data.frame) #>  $ hemi  : chr [1:70] "left" "left" "left" "left" ... #>  $ region: chr [1:70] "banks of superior temporal sulcus" "caudal anterior cingulate" "caudal middle frontal" "corpus callosum" ... #>  $ label : chr [1:70] "lh_bankssts" "lh_caudalanteriorcingulate" "lh_caudalmiddlefrontal" "lh_corpuscallosum" ... #>  $ lobe  : chr [1:70] "temporal" "cingulate" "frontal" "white matter" ... unique(dk$core$lobe) #> [1] "temporal"     "cingulate"    "frontal"      "white matter" "occipital"    #> [6] "parietal"     "insula"

title: The ggseg_atlas object
text: set accessor functions lets pull information without reaching slots directly. atlas_regions() returns sorted unique region names: atlas_labels() returns unique labels (identifiers used join geometry): atlas_views() returns available 2D views: atlas_type() returns type string: atlas_palette() retrieves colour palette. can pass atlas object directly name string:
code: atlas_regions(dk) #>  [1] "banks of superior temporal sulcus" "caudal anterior cingulate"         #>  [3] "caudal middle frontal"             "corpus callosum"                   #>  [5] "cuneus"                            "entorhinal"                        #>  [7] "frontal pole"                      "fusiform"                          #>  [9] "inferior parietal"                 "inferior temporal"                 #> [11] "insula"                            "isthmus cingulate"                 #> [13] "lateral occipital"                 "lateral orbitofrontal"             #> [15] "lingual"                           "medial orbitofrontal"              #> [17] "middle temporal"                   "paracentral"                       #> [19] "parahippocampal"                   "pars opercularis"                  #> [21] "pars orbitalis"                    "pars triangularis"                 #> [23] "pericalcarine"                     "postcentral"                       #> [25] "posterior cingulate"               "precentral"                        #> [27] "precuneus"                         "rostral anterior cingulate"        #> [29] "rostral middle frontal"            "superior frontal"                  #> [31] "superior parietal"                 "superior temporal"                 #> [33] "supramarginal"                     "temporal pole"                     #> [35] "transverse temporal" head(atlas_labels(dk)) #> [1] "lh_bankssts"                "lh_caudalanteriorcingulate" #> [3] "lh_caudalmiddlefrontal"     "lh_corpuscallosum"          #> [5] "lh_cuneus"                  "lh_entorhinal" atlas_views(dk) #> [1] "inferior" "lateral"  "medial"   "superior" atlas_views(aseg) #> [1] "axial_3"   "axial_5"   "coronal_2" "coronal_3" "coronal_4" "sagittal" atlas_views(tracula) #> [1] "axial_2"          "axial_4"          "coronal_3"        "coronal_4"        #> [5] "sagittal_left"    "sagittal_midline" "sagittal_right" atlas_type(dk) #> [1] "cortical" atlas_type(aseg) #> [1] "subcortical" atlas_type(tracula) #> [1] "tract" head(atlas_palette(dk)) #>                lh_bankssts lh_caudalanteriorcingulate  #>                  "#196428"                  "#7D64A0"  #>     lh_caudalmiddlefrontal          lh_corpuscallosum  #>                  "#641900"                  "#784632"  #>                  lh_cuneus              lh_entorhinal  #>                  "#DC1464"                  "#DC140A"

title: The ggseg_atlas object
text: need actual data frames ggseg ggseg3d consume, use atlas_*() extractors. join core metadata palette colours onto raw geometry get single, ready--use table. atlas_sf() returns sf data frame 2D rendering: atlas_vertices() returns vertex data cortical 3D rendering: atlas_meshes() returns mesh data subcortical tract 3D rendering: .data.frame() convenience method produces merged sf data frame similar atlas_sf() atlas-level columns (atlas, type) attached:

title: The ggseg_atlas object
text: is_ggseg_atlas() tests whether object right class: as_ggseg_atlas() coerces lists right structure proper ggseg_atlas: atlas object older version ggseg stored sf data directly $data instead using new ggseg_atlas_data wrapper, convert_legacy_brain_atlas() migrate unified format.
code: is_ggseg_atlas(dk) #> [1] TRUE is_ggseg_atlas(mtcars) #> [1] FALSE atlas_list <- as.list(dk) recovered <- as_ggseg_atlas(atlas_list) is_ggseg_atlas(recovered) #> [1] TRUE

what: Brain Atlas Data Structures for the ggseg Ecosystem
title: Brain Atlas Data Structures for the ggseg Ecosystem
text: ggseg.formats provides ggseg_atlas S3 class powers ggseg ecosystem 2D 3D brain visualisation. ships three bundled atlases, set accessor functions querying atlas contents, pipe-friendly manipulation API subsetting, renaming, enriching atlas objects.

title: Brain Atlas Data Structures for the ggseg Ecosystem
text: package includes three atlases covering main atlas types: dk — Desikan-Killiany cortical parcellation (68 regions) aseg — FreeSurfer automatic subcortical segmentation tracula — TRACULA white matter tract atlas
code: library(ggseg.formats) dk #>  #> ── dk ggseg atlas ────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Type: cortical #> Regions: 35 #> Hemispheres: left, right #> Views: inferior, title: Brain Atlas Data Structures for the ggseg Ecosystem
text: Atlas objects designed exploration customisation. can query regions, filter views, pipe operations together:
code: aseg |>   atlas_region_keep("hippocampus|amygdala|thalamus") |>   atlas_view_keep("sagittal") |>   atlas_view_gather() #>  #> ── aseg ggseg atlas ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Type: subcortical #> Regions: 3 #> Hemispheres: left, right #> Views: sagittal #> Palette: ✔ #> Rendering: ✔ ggseg #> ✔ ggseg3d (meshes) #> ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> # A tibble: 6 × 4 #>   hemi  region      label             structure #>   <chr> <chr>       <chr>             <chr>     #> 1 left  thalamus    Left-Thalamus     thalamus  #> 2 left  hippocampus Left-Hippocampus  limbic    #> 3 left  amygdala    Left-Amygdala     limbic    #> 4 right thalamus    Right-Thalamus    thalamus  #> 5 right hippocampus Right-Hippocampus limbic    #> 6 right amygdala    Right-Amygdala    limbic

title: FreeSurfer Automatic Subcortical Segmentation Atlas — aseg

title: FreeSurfer Automatic Subcortical Segmentation Atlas — aseg
text: atlas contains bilateral structures: Thalamus Caudate Putamen Pallidum (globus pallidus) Hippocampus Amygdala Accumbens (nucleus accumbens) Ventral diencephalon Plus midline ventricular structures: Lateral ventricles Third ventricle Fourth ventricle Brain stem Cerebellar cortex Cerebellar white matter

what: Manipulate brain atlas regions and views — atlas_manipulation
title: Manipulate brain atlas regions and views — atlas_manipulation
text: Functions modifying brain atlas objects. cover three areas:

title: Manipulate brain atlas regions and views — atlas_manipulation
code: atlas_region_remove(atlas, pattern, match_on = c("region", "label"))  atlas_region_contextual(atlas, pattern, match_on = c("region", "label"))  atlas_region_rename(atlas, pattern, replacement)  atlas_region_keep(atlas, pattern, match_on = c("region", "label"))  atlas_core_add(atlas, data, by = "region")  atlas_view_remove(atlas, views)  atlas_view_keep(atlas, views)  atlas_view_remove_region(   atlas,   pattern,   match_on = c("label", "region"),   views = NULL )  atlas_view_remove_small(atlas, min_area, views = NULL)  atlas_view_gather(atlas, gap = 0.15)  atlas_view_reorder(atlas, order, gap = 0.15)

title: Manipulate brain atlas regions and views — atlas_manipulation
text: atlas ggseg_atlas object pattern Character pattern match. Uses grepl(..., ignore.case = TRUE). match_on Column match : "region" "label". replacement atlas_region_rename(): replacement string function. data atlas_core_add(): data.frame metadata join. atlas_core_add(): column(s) join . Default "region". views view functions: character vector view names patterns. Multiple values collapsed "|" matching. min_area atlas_view_remove_small(): minimum polygon area keep. Context geometries never removed. gap Proportional gap views (default 0.15 = 15% max width). order atlas_view_reorder(): character vector desired view order. Unspecified views appended end.

title: Manipulate brain atlas regions and views — atlas_manipulation
text: Modified ggseg_atlas object

title: Manipulate brain atlas regions and views — atlas_manipulation
text: Region manipulation modifies regions active atlas: atlas_region_remove(): completely remove regions atlas_region_contextual(): keep geometry remove core/palette atlas_region_rename(): rename regions core atlas_region_keep(): keep matching regions View manipulation modifies 2D sf geometry data: atlas_view_remove(): remove entire views atlas_view_keep(): keep matching views atlas_view_remove_region(): remove specific region geometry sf atlas_view_remove_small(): remove small polygon fragments atlas_view_gather(): reposition views close gaps atlas_view_reorder(): change view order Core manipulation modifies atlas metadata: atlas_core_add(): join additional metadata columns

title: Manipulate brain atlas regions and views — atlas_manipulation
text: atlas_region_contextual(): Keep geometry visual context remove core, palette, 3D data. Context geometries render grey appear legends. atlas_region_rename(): Rename regions matching pattern. affects region column, label. replacement function, receives matched names returns new names. atlas_region_keep(): Keep matching regions. Non-matching regions removed core, palette, 3D data sf geometry preserved surface continuity. atlas_core_add(): Join additional metadata columns atlas core. atlas_view_remove(): Remove views matching pattern sf data. atlas_view_keep(): Keep views matching pattern. atlas_view_remove_region(): Remove specific region geometry sf data . Core, palette, 3D data unchanged. atlas_view_remove_small(): Remove region geometries minimum area threshold. Context geometries (labels core) never removed. Optionally scope specific views. atlas_view_gather(): Reposition remaining views close gaps view removal. atlas_view_reorder(): Reorder views reposition. Views order appended end.

title: Manipulate brain atlas regions and views — atlas_manipulation
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ atlas <- atlas |>   atlas_region_remove("White-Matter") |>   atlas_region_contextual("cortex") |>   atlas_view_keep(c("axial_3", "coronal_2", "sagittal")) |>   atlas_view_remove_small(min_area = 50) |>   atlas_view_gather() } # }

what: Convert legacy ggseg atlases to ggseg_atlas format — convert_legacy_brain_atlas
title: Convert legacy ggseg atlases to ggseg_atlas format — convert_legacy_brain_atlas
text: Convert old-style ggseg (2D) ggseg3d (3D) atlases new ggseg_atlas format. bridge function working existing atlases transition period. new atlases, use ggsegExtra::create_cortical_atlas() ggsegExtra::create_subcortical_atlas() instead - produce better results proper vertex indices. function handles three scenarios: 2D 3D: Merges geometry vertex data 3D : Extracts vertices, infers indices mesh coordinates 2D : Keeps geometry, 3D rendering unavailable 3D atlas already contains vertex indices (newer ggseg3d atlases), preserved. Otherwise, vertex indices inferred mesh coordinates using hash-based matching (FreeSurfer needed).

NULL, derived input. type Atlas type: "cortical" "subcortical". NULL, inferred input atlases. surface surface match inferring vertices (e.g., "inflated"). Must match 3D atlas surface exactly. brain_meshes Optional user-supplied brain meshes vertex inference.

title: Get brain surface mesh — get_brain_mesh

title: Get brain surface mesh — get_brain_mesh
text: hemisphere "lh" "rh" surface Surface type (default "inflated"). surfaces require ggseg3d custom brain_meshes argument. brain_meshes Optional user-supplied mesh data. Accepts either list(lh = list(vertices, faces), rh = ...) legacy list(lh_inflated = list(vertices, faces), ...) format.

title: Get brain surface mesh — get_brain_mesh
text: list vertices (data.frame x, y, z) faces (data.frame , j, k), NULL mesh available.

May contain additional columns grouping metadata (e.g., lobe, network, Brodmann area). data ggseg_atlas_data object created ggseg_data_cortical(), ggseg_data_subcortical(), ggseg_data_tract(). Must match specified type. palette named character vector colours keyed label

Optional. centerlines data.frame columns: label: tract identifier (character) points: list-column n x 3 matrices (centerline coordinates) tangents: list-column n x 3 matrices (orientation coloring) tube_radius Radius tube mesh generation. Default 5. tube_segments Number segments around tube circumference. Default 8. meshes Deprecated. Use centerlines instead. provided, converted centerlines format.

what: TRACULA White Matter Tract Atlas — tracula
title: TRACULA White Matter Tract Atlas — tracula
text: Brain atlas FreeSurfer's TRACULA (TRActs Constrained UnderLying Anatomy) white matter bundles MNI space.

title: TRACULA White Matter Tract Atlas — tracula
code: data(tracula)

title: TRACULA White Matter Tract Atlas — tracula
text: ggseg_atlas object components: atlas Character. Atlas name ("tracula") type Character. Atlas type ("tract") palette Named character vector colours tract data ggseg_data_tract object containing: centerlines List centerline matrices per tract sf Simple features data frame 2D rendering

title: TRACULA White Matter Tract Atlas — tracula
text: atlas contains major white matter tracts reconstructed diffusion MRI using FreeSurfer's TRACULA training data. works ggseg (2D slice projections) ggseg3d (3D tube mesh visualizations).

title: TRACULA White Matter Tract Atlas — tracula
text: Yendiki , Panneck P, Srinivasan P, et al. (2011). Automated probabilistic reconstruction white-matter pathways health disease using atlas underlying anatomy. Frontiers Neuroinformatics, 5:23. doi:10.3389/fninf.2011.00023

what: Validate data labels against core — validate_data_labels
title: Validate data labels against core — validate_data_labels
text: 3D sources (vertices, meshes, centerlines) validated strictly: every core label must corresponding entry. check always runs.

title: Validate data labels against core — validate_data_labels
code: validate_data_labels(data, core, check_sf = FALSE)

title: Validate data labels against core — validate_data_labels
text: data ggseg_atlas_data object core core data.frame check_sf TRUE, validate sf label coverage core

title: Validate data labels against core — validate_data_labels
text: data (unchanged)

title: Validate data labels against core — validate_data_labels
text: check_sf = TRUE (default construction time), sf coverage also checked: error raised fewer 80 percent core labels appear sf, warning fewer 90 percent. threshold relaxed 2D projections always capture every region (small, occluded, etc.). manipulation (view removal, region cleanup) sf coverage naturally drops, rebuild_atlas calls check_sf = FALSE. Labels data core always allowed — represent context-geometry (like medial wall) renders grey without appearing legends.
